meanings.definition: The state or quality of being solid.
meanings.sent1: The solidity of the rock made it difficult to break.
meanings.sent2: The table's solidity was evident as it held up under the weight of the heavy books.
meanings.sent3: The solidity of the ice cream cone was put to the test on a hot summer day.
meanings.sent4: Her handshake had a solidity that conveyed confidence and strength.
meanings.sent5: The solidity of the brick wall made it a reliable barrier against the wind.

meanings.definition: The ability to withstand stress or pressure.
meanings.sent1: The bridge's solidity ensured it could support heavy traffic without any issues.
meanings.sent2: The building's design prioritized solidity to ensure it could withstand earthquakes.
meanings.sent3: The solidity of the rubber band was unexpectedly tested when it held together a bunch of papers.
meanings.sent4: His mental solidity helped him remain calm and composed during the crisis.
meanings.sent5: The solidity of the tree roots kept the tree firmly anchored in the ground.

meanings.definition: The degree of firmness or stability.
meanings.sent1: The solidity of the mattress provided a comfortable sleeping surface.
meanings.sent2: The chair's solidity was reassuring as it supported his weight without creaking.
meanings.sent3: The solidity of the jello surprised everyone when it didn't wobble on the plate.
meanings.sent4: Her voice had a solidity that commanded attention in the noisy room.
meanings.sent5: The solidity of the foundation ensured the building stood strong against the storm.
